intro: Heliotropium senense, commonly known as the West Indian heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are usually violet or purple in color, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Heliotropium senense thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed sites.
